p: The new combination of AZT, together with other drug classes like the non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor (NNRTI), Efavirenz (EFV), has reported promising results on multidrug-resistant HIV-1 patients [ 37]. To date, studies are continuously evaluating the potential of drugs to repurpose for HIV as it is often regarded as an incurable chronic disease [ 77, 78]. For example, it was discovered that two current drugs, iodixanol, and sirolimus work synergistically at specific concentrations for HIV treatment via molecular docking simulations [ 78].
